page.title: 02GENERAL INFORMATION
page.content: The area surveyed in N.W. Bucks is about 90% farmland and open spaces. Akeley lies in the S.E. corner and Lillingstone Dayrell covers 3Km square. Landscape is undulating with winding roads - the A413 runs from N. to S. linking the villages with Buckingham and Northampton. N.W. lies one of the fee-paying schools, Charmandean, in park and woodland. Akeley Wood School is south and covering 1Km square is the grounds of Stowe Public School. Akeley is on the third highest peak in Bucks. The village centre is compact and covers .5Km - a very quiet area, there being neither shop, church, industry nor entertainment and only one pub. Akeley has a village first school but for how long? AKELEY = ACHELEI D.B. L.D. = LELINCHESTUNE D.B.
